Stop Dirty money in Arizona politics

For too long, anonymous political spending — what we call “Dirty Money” — has run Arizona politics. We want to change that — we want to Outlaw Dirty Money.


Get Involved Today!

Outlaw Dirty Money

Dirty Money means political spending when the original source remains secret.  Also called Dark Money. The corporations and wealthy individuals spending Dirty Money remain hidden from the voters while they try to manipulate elections.

Arizona is the point of the spear for Dirty Money because the Arizona Legislature keeps making it easier for the big donors to hide.  Since 2010, more political advertising has been secretly funded here, as a percentage of total campaign spending, than in any other state.  And, Dirty Money has been more successful here. In 2014, candidates with backing from anonymous sources won every statewide office but one. 

Dirty Money hurts.  We recently learned that in 2014 APS spent $10.7 million in secret funds to elect two members of the rate setting Corporation Commission.  Those Commissioners then voted for a $95 million per year electric rate increase.   Public education, the environment and social services are all targets of Dirty Money.

What we’re doing about it

It will take the signatures of 357,000 Arizona voters to put the non-partisan Outlaw Dirty Money Initiative on the November 2020 ballot.  When that happens, Arizona voters can Outlaw Dirty Money in Arizona for good.

How to contribute

The Issue Affects Everyone

It’s up to us, the voters, to stop the Dirty Money poison from further polluting our democracy.
Terry Goddard
Former Arizona Attorney General

Help Fund the Fight!

We’re not funded by Dirty Money, special interest forces — we’re funded by Arizonans who are tired of their democracy being sold to the highest bidder. Can you join us?
